put.summary: Edits an existing Scratch Space user information
put.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

400.description: Malformed Scratch Storage object or malformed user UUID

409.description: Scratch User Email Address is already is use

delete.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

put.summary: Edit existing scratch space app information (its name)
put.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

409.description: App Name is already is use

400.description: Malformed request body / app name already exists or appId is malformed

delete.summary: Deletes this application from the Common API registry (removes from scratch space use)
delete.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

get.summary: Retrieves a person by ID
get.description: Retrieves a person by ID

parameters.name: memberships
parameters.description: Whether to include this person's organization memberships in the response

parameters.name: leaderships
parameters.description: Whether to include the organization ids this person is the leader of in the response

get.summary: Retrieves an organization by ID
get.description: Retrieves an organization by ID

parameters.name: flatten
parameters.description: Whether to flatten out all attached members and organizations contained therein

parameters.name: people
parameters.description: Comma-separated string list of fields to include in Person type sub-fields. Example: people=id,firstName,lastName

parameters.name: organizations
parameters.description: Comma-separated string list of fields to include in Organizational type sub-fields. Example: organizations=id,name

schema.description: Object hash containing the keys to modify (set fields to null to clear that field)

get.summary: Retrieves a dashboard user by ID
get.description: Retrieves a dashboard user by ID

get.summary: Returns the details for an App Source
get.description: Requires DASHBOARD_ADMIN or APP_SOURCE_ADMIN rights.

put.summary: Updates the details for an App Source
put.description: Requires DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights or be APP_SOURCE_ADMIN  of given App Id. Admin users can also be managed via this request method.  Emails for app source admins to a given App Source UUID will be implicitly added as new  DashboardUsers with the APP_SOURCE_ADMIN privilege.  Conversely a PUT that takes away an email that was there before  will be deleted as a DashboardUser if that email address does not have any other privileges in the system or its an  app source admin to some other app source application.

delete.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

get.summary: Get an App Client's Information
get.description: Get an App Client by its UUID. Requires DASHBOARD_ADMIN or be an App Client Developer of that UUID.

404.description: Resource with that ID doesn't exist

403.description: Requester isn't a DASHBOARD_ADMIN or an App Client Developer of this App Client

put.description: Updates an existing Application Client. Requires DASHBOARD_ADMIN access to change any attribute,or be APP_CLIENT_DEVELOPER role for app client of given UUID to be able to manage change App Client Developers - any of fields changed as APP_CLIENT_DEVELOPER will not be changed.

delete.description: Deletes an existing App Client. Requires DASHBOARD_ADMIN access.

post.summary: Retrieves all ledger entries from specified event count(s) and event types(s)
post.description: Simply provide a list of type EventInfoDto containing the event types and the LAST event count received for that event. The returned list will contain, as its start point, the point in time at which the oldest of those event types(s)/event count(s) occurred at - the remainder of that list will be event entries containing only events specified in the request body. Note the event count(s) provided should be equal to the actual count received from Common.  This endpoint will know to return events from that count + 1.

schema.description: List of events and counts to rewind to and playback

post.summary: Add one or more members to the database
post.description: Adds one or more person entities - returns that same array of input persons with their assigned UUIDs. If the request does NOT return 201 (Created) because of an error (see other return codes), then no new persons will have been committed to the database (if one entity fails, the entire operation fails). The return error message will list the offending UUID or other data that caused the error.

409.description: A person already exists with the id provided

post.summary: Retrieves a person by email or dodid
post.description: Retrieves a person using a single identifying property.

parameters.name: memberships
parameters.description: Whether to include this person's organization memberships in the response

parameters.name: leaderships
parameters.description: Whether to include the organization ids this person is the leader of in the response

post.summary: Adds one or more organization entities
post.description: Adds one or more organization entities - returns that same array of input organizations with their assigned UUIDs. If the request does NOT return 201 (Created) because of an error (see other return codes), then any new organizations up to that organization that caused the failure will have been committed (but none thereafter)The return error message will list the offending UUID or other data that caused the error.

409.description: Bad Request / One of the supplied organizations contained a UUID that already exists or other duplicate data

get.summary: Retrieves all registered subscriptions
get.description: Retrieves all subscriptions

post.description: Adds a new subscription, or updates an existing subscription

post.summary: Treats the key's value as JSON and returns the JsonPath query invoked onto that JSON structure. Returns JSON string matching the specified JSON Path
post.description: App ID is the UUID of the owning application

400.description: Malformed Application UUID / Value cannot be jsonized / Unable to serialize response to JSON

404.description: Application ID / Key name not valid or found / JSON path spec not found

patch.summary: Treats the key's value as JSON and attempts to update a portion of it from given JSON Patch spec with provided value.  Returns NO_CONTENT response on successful update.
patch.description: App ID is the UUID of the owning application

404.description: Application ID / Key name not valid or found

400.description: Malformed Application UUID / Value cannot be jsonized / Bad JSON Path / Unable to serialize response to JSON

get.summary: Gets the entire table of Scratch Space users (ID, email...)

post.summary: Adds a new Scratch Space user by their P1 email address
post.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

409.description: Scratch User UUID or email address is already is use

get.summary: Gets the entire table of Scratch Storage apps that are registered with Common API

post.summary: Adds a new Scratch Strorage consuming app name to the Common API scratch storage space
post.description: Requester has to have DASHBOARD_ADMIN rights

409.description: App UUID or App Name is already is use

400.description: Malformed request body or app name already exists

get.summary: Retrieves all key-value pairs for all scratch space consuming apps
get.description: Requires request to be under DASHBOARD_ADMIN privileges

post.summary: Adds or updates a key-value pair for a given App Id
post.description: SCRATCH_WRITE privileges are required for the requester for the given App Id

403.description: Write / Update action forbidden - no WRITE privileges

404.description: Application ID / Key name not valid or found

get.summary: Retrieves all persons
get.description: Retrieves all persons  with pagination information

parameters.name: memberships
parameters.description: Whether to include this person's organization memberships in the response

parameters.name: leaderships
parameters.description: Whether to include the organization ids this person is the leader of in the response

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

link.description: Contains the appropriate pagination links if application. If no pagination query params given, then no pagination links will exist. Possible rel values include: first, last, prev, next

post.description: Adds a person.  Query Ranks controller for available Ranks and Branches. If a given Rank or Branch is invalid, the Person will be created with rank 'Unknown' and branch 'Other'

409.description: Resource already exists with the id provided

get.summary: Retrieves all organizations
get.description: Retrieves all organizations.  Optionally can provide 'type' parameter (e.g. 'WING') to filter by Organization type and/or 'branch' parameter to filter by branch of service (e.g 'USAF'). If neither parameter is given, then no filters are applied and request returns all Organizations.  Optionally can also provide 'search' parameter to search on organization names within the result set (case in-sensitive).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Case insensitive search string for org name

parameters.name: people
parameters.description: Comma-separated string list to include in Person type sub-fields. Example: people=id,firstName,lastName

parameters.name: organizations
parameters.description: Comma-separated string list to include in Organization type sub-fields. Example: organizations=id,name

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

link.description: Contains the appropriate pagination links if application. If no pagination query params given, then no pagination links will exist. Possible rel values include: first, last, prev, next

400.description: Bad Request - likely due to invalid unit type or branch of service specified

409.description: Resource already exists with the id provided

get.description: Retrieves all Dashboard Users

409.description: Resource already exists with the email provided

get.summary: Retrieves the full record of a particular request
get.description: Must have DASHBOARD_ADMIN privilege to access. This detailed info includes the request/response bodies (if present)

get.summary: Retrieves a subset of the server http trace logs from a specified date
get.description: Must have DASHBOARD_ADMIN privilege to access.  Date time given is in the format 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss' and should be in UTC time. This date time parameter is required.  This is also a pageable interface (using page and size query params).

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The date/time from which to query from - format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss - in UTC

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: HTTP method to filter on, e.g. GET, POST, etc

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: HTTP response status to sort on

parameters.name: userAgentContains
parameters.description: Filter by user agent containing given string

parameters.name: requestedUrlContains
parameters.description: Filter by requested url containing given string

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the page to be returned

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property(,asc|desc). Default sort order is ascending. Multiple sort criteria are supported.

link.description: Contains the appropriate pagination links if application. If no pagination query params given, then no pagination links will exist. Possible rel values include: first, last, prev, next
